poem:
### Of Politics and Plain Folks

The plain folk's heart's desire—  
a White House, a reflection  
of foolishness adorned,  
narcissistic whispers echo  
in the halls of power.  
Tariffs teeter on the brink—  
dreams teeter too,  
while Europe gazes,  
our laughter flecked  
with fear,  
as we dance  
in the shadows  
of perfected democracy.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Without the EU, the joke is on us if Trump gets his tariffs | William Keegan ‘As democracy is perfected, the office of president represents, more and more closely, the inner soul of the people. On some great and glorious day the plain folks of the land will reach their heart’s desire at last, and the White House will be occupied by a downright fool and complete narcissistic moron.” Those were the words of the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
